name: Loi Estiatorio
address: 132 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text: This  is the ultimate Manhattan Greek dining experience. Warm and homey - Chef Maria Loi is a delight. Everything is distinct and fresh. Octopus and Branzino! Kataifi is sublime! Trust me. Itâ€™ll cost u but is worth it!

This is one of the best restaurants in all of Manhattan. There are tons of choices, but when you find one that just seems to hit all the marks, why go anywhere else? Not only is the hospitality top-notch from Chef Maria Loi, but the house manager, Alex, is amazing. They are both so friendly and make you feel like family. Chef takes such great care in greeting each guest and making us all feel at home. The same goes for Alex. We had a great conversation with him after our meal. The quality of the food only adds to the atmosphere. It's so close to Times Square and all the touristy locales, but if you really want to experience NYC, I highly recommend Loi Estiatorio. It's literally my go-to for client and personal meals. This past visit I tried the branzino and it was absolutely fantastic, with a nice char-grilled flavor, but light an flaky. The pastas are cooked to perfection, and spreads are absolutely amazing. The food is filling, but you won't feel miserable from trying everything! Fun fact, but ALL of the meals prepared here don't use butter. Instead, everything is prepared with the finest olive oil, and you can really taste a difference - especially with the baklava. This really is one of the best restaurants in all of NYC. Give it a try and you'll see exactly why this intimate Greek restaurant is a treat for the senses. You won't be disappointed. Absolute classic Greek.

Great food, outstanding service, and the kindest attention weâ€™ve ever received toward our toddlers. Iâ€™d give it 100 stars if I could, not just 5! Weâ€™ll definitely be back!

Maria Loi and her team are amazing!!

Loi is unbelievable!!! When it comes to food, friendliness and flexibility. Myself and my wife were having a micro-wedding in Central Park and wanted something amazing that was close by so we could all walk, following our ceremony at the Ladies Pavilion. Alex and Maria (Loi Estiatorio) could not have been more accommodating and flexible to make our wedding day and reception so amazing and so memorable.

First of all, the food is a delight. Greek food that blows Gyro's or kabobs away (those are great too, but Loi is a whole different levl of great). The Octopus appetizer (which we loved having eaten at Loi in the past) was a favorite by all. Branzino and Lamb Shanks were popular dinner options, and the menu had something for everybody.

Great shared appetizers to start, beautiful entrees to choose from, and a all encompassing desert with a little of everything (try the Baklava!!). We also like to drink and the wine was amazing, beer crisp, and the cocktails exceptional (try the espresso martini!).

We had a few late changes to who was arriving, we also wanted to work with a decor person as well as have a wedding cake dropped off, and Loi couldn't have been happier to work with us and our vendors to pull off the most special day on 10/25/25. I've put a few photos of the ambiance, decor and food in the review.

We cannot wait to come back for our 1st wedding anniversary and hope you take the time to read this and give Loi a try on your visit to NYC or if you're looking for something delicious in a beautiful setting.

Thank you Alex and Maria for making our day a dream come true. We will be back and can't tell enough people about you!

- Colin & Debby

Beyond Exceptional. This location is a global institution, and stands head and shoulders above any other Greek Restaurant in North America for a great variety of reasons. Probably above most upscle Manhattan restaurants in general at this level. Maria Loi's depth of knowledge, judgement and humulity in the context of what she has accomplushed and continues to push for is Professorial, at the level of a departmental chairman in an Ivy league University ... and do personally know a few....So I know;-)
On my first visit, whilst I did try to avoid taking up her time, Professor Loi prompted me to ask questions, and gave me valuable, pragmatic advice, particularly in the context of struggling to recreate the same nutritional value and tastes / textures in cooking food that would normally be easy if the ingredients had been freshly available in Greece or Cyprus. It more than worked.
It is fascinating to reviewing Maria's trajectory from European diplomat, lobbyist, media relations, and now as a philanthropist, television personality, and multiple invitstions as speaker at academic conferences on longevity and the mediterranean diet.
Everything on the menu is beyond carefully thought out, coinsistent, and meticulously prepared. What is presented has dense nutritional value, is expertly cooked and sourced from suppliers that us mere mortals have limited access to -  Maria's mediterranean seafood supplier being a prime example.
To an extent, the menu is a mainstream representation for what would usually be palatable to mainstream US based clients. And  that is why God created places like Tsolias on Nicocleous street in Ledra - where we can have Kefalaki, Kokoretsi, Elassonitiko, Kontosouvli, and Sheftalies I am not "just going to eat" what my Yiayia ate.
Thank you Maria Loi for all that you have done and continue to do for society as a whole. It far exceeds what "restauranteurs" would normally envision in terms of promoting healthy living concepts. A perfect example of this is how you forcibly keep the the price of your olive oil down, despite multiple and repeated attempts by Amazon to inflate the price. That's integrity! And More.

I live in the city , I work in the city!!  When I was a good good home meal- I go to LOI!!!  Maria and her team doing an outstanding job making customers feel WELCOME .

The food , the deserts , the wine.  Please try it.  You will THANK ME for the referral. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸
Very nice greek place. Food is decent. Great value for money.
Good Greek restaurant.

I found true authentic cooking here. You can enjoy superb dishes without overpaying. The team combines information with approachability. They've created an atmosphere through thoughtful design. Loi Estiatorio staff delivered good service.
AMAZING!!!
We had a lovely evening here. Delicious food, and such a warm welcome, especially from Nicole. We are from out of town, but will definitely be back.

Went for an impromptu dinner with my boyfriend and ended up having such an incredible night. Everyone here was so warm and welcoming and to top it off the food was beyond delicious. Thank you Nicole for your hospitality ğŸ˜Š

Every bite here makes me make happy noises. Each menu item delivered great taste. The value exceeds the price point. Staff maintains awareness, addresses inquiries promptly and serves exceptionally. This spot has earned my complete loyalty.

Delicious food in a warm and welcoming atmosphere. I am a vegetarian and this restaurant has been on my bucket list for at least a year. It was completely worth the wait. We loved the food, wait staff and the Maitre D, Nicole. Everyone was friendly, informative and attentive. The restaurant is well appointed with a lovely curved bar, comfortable seating and a panoramic view of chef Mariaâ€™s view from her house in Greece. This restaurant is a delight, if I lived closer I would eat here every week!
Such a good cuisine and people. Cozy and warm atmosphere. Delicious food ğŸ«¶ğŸ»

I confess returning to this restaurant often. The meals were reliably tasty, don't misinterpret. The team handled everything appropriately. The experience left nothing to be desired. I promoted this fine restaurant.
The dishes were so delicious. Perfectly seasoned. They even gave us free dessert afterwards! The server was extremely friendly and we had a chance to meet the owner. She is such an amazing woman.

The best Greek food I have ever had! From the wine, to the lentil soup, to the stuffed eggplant, and lamb .... There are options for everyone! I'm gluten free and felt like I could order almost anything without any fear! Maria also personally spoke to us and gave me helpful postpartum tips re: food. Highly recommend to everyone.
Great atmosphere, service and food.  The BEST!!!!! frappe ever!!!!!!!!!  The only thing that could make this place better is if I could eat there everyday. Maria, the owner, is incredible.

I very much enjoyed my experience at Loi Estiatorio from start to finish. The staff treats you as if you are family including chef Maria Loi who personally came to my table and introduced herself. I ordered the whole branzino and it was fresh and delicious. Cant recommend this place enough if you find yourself in midtown this is the place to go!

We visited Loi Estiatorio on Friday with family and had an absolutely wonderful experience. From the vibrant village salad and perfectly grilled Halloumi cheese to the authentic spinach pie, flavorful grape leaves, house-made pasta, and delicately cooked Branzino, every bite was a delight. The Vidiano wine paired beautifully with the meal, and the dessert capped the evening perfectly.
Chef Loiâ€™s passion and dedication truly shine through in every dish, bringing authentic Greek flavors to life. Alex and Nicola made us feel so welcome with their warm, and attentive service!
It was a memorable night shared with family, and we canâ€™t wait to come back. Loi Estiatorio is not only the best Greek restaurant in New Yorkâ€”itâ€™s the best in the world! Highly recommend!

I had their pan seared Salmon entree ($42) which was served medium rare, as requested. It was delicious, this is one of the few places that has served it medium rare AND perfectly hot, like it would be if it was cooked longer for a medium result. The restaurant is located at 132 West 58th Street, not far from 5th Avenue.

What a great service .Chef Maria was very friendly , she explained everything about the food. Everything we ordered was amazing , my favorite was branzino . She is a great human being as well . She is the angel of Manhattan . It was such a honor  to finally met her
Geweldig! Supervers, puur en smaakvol. We aten een Griekse salade, geroosterde pita met spreads, branzino, kip en moussaka. Alles uitmuntend. Ik zou hier elke dag kunnen eten.
Had an amazing lunch here today, the service? Top notch,  the food? To die for. This was a great experience,  (take a shot of the olive oil) will definitely be back soon!
Very nice people, good food, Nicole was a very nice person! Everything was great ğŸ‘
They let us sit here after we were walking around all day, we came back for dinner at the food was good
Poco o nada destacado en el local. Esperaba productos de mayor calidad en un restaurante referenciado como Griego.  Excesivamente caro para lo que se come.
Drinks to watery,main courses have no taste.Very simple.Servise below average.

Chef Maria and her wonderful staff make dining at the restaurant feel like being welcomed into a beautiful home. Everything I had was so beautifully presented and thoughtfully prepared. All the highest quality ingredients showcased in the best possible way. Chef Maria has an international curiosity  about food, culture and connection you can watch on her tv show on PBS. I feel so lucky to have this gem in my neighborhood!
I mean! You can not get a better greek experience than this. One word. Ingredients

My Sisters first NYC trip and she had only 1 requestâ€¦Late Lunch @Loiestiatorio ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡· ğŸ˜šnot only did we receive top-notch service but Maria herself came out and chatted with us making it the absolute perfect daytrip!ğŸ¥° Maria is a rockstar so is Pepe and all the employees at Loi!! It was a wonderful and enchanting meal. Next time Hugh Jackman has to join usğŸ˜ğŸ¤£ğŸ«¶ğŸ»

Quite simply the best Greek food we have had.   Celebrity Chef Maria Loi was there and she greeted us with a very warm smile.  Nicole who seated us made sure we were very welcome and made it a point to be comfortable.  All the dishes were outstanding.  Yes, it was on the expensive side but was worth it.

We arrived way early for the dinner but got a very big welcome. The restaurant was cozy with extremely friendly staffs and chef Loi also came to check out. Everything from Greek salad to Moussaka was fantastic and the sea bass was well prepared with minimal seasonings, loved by all three of us. The white wine from Santorini went extremely well with the dishes without being overwhelming. The dessert samples were served without extra charges. A Must visit if you are close to the area. Will come back again!

Stopped by for a quick bite with a date and had some of the best Mediterranean food Iâ€™ve had in NYC as of yet. The hostess and chef both were wonderful and all staff was very personable, most definitely will be returning and recommend you stop here during your time in the city as well!

Chef Maria prepared me the most fantastic meals I've had in an incredibly long time!! She made me feel what it was like to have truly authentic Greek cuisine again. It's been so long since my Papou was around, but I felt right at home eating here! I came back the very next day because it really was that remarkable! Her culinary excellence is representative of the best of Greece! â¤ï¸ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·
Excelente atenciÃ³n y servicio

This quaint little restaurant serves excellent and authentic Greek cuisine. I was very pleased with the branzino and had fun trying some of their assortment of Greek wines. The service was outstanding. I left with a warm belly and a warm heart and cannot wait for the next opportunity to come back. I hope others may enjoy their food and atmosphere

5+ stars! A â€œMust Dineâ€ in NYC!! Excellent food and wine. Top-notch service. Our server was on point in explaining the menu and suggesting wine pairings with our meals.Â Chef Loi and team attended to our every need while taking us on a culinary journey to Greece.
Thank you for indulging us with such a unique and memorable dining experience!

We live in NYC and often dine out, but our outstanding meal at Loi was a very special experience and we marveled that we had not been here before. The food was fresh, abundant and delicious.  The service and personal attention was above and beyond.   We so enjoyed chatting with the chef and staff including  Maria, Nicola, Tom and Alex. It felt like the warmth, and home touch of a family restaurant in a small village while maintaining top quality NYC culinary standards.  Congratulations, many thanks,  and we can't wait to return!

The food is average at best. The service was fine. Not really much of an atmosphere. My biggest gripe is the price point is on par with two of my favorite Greek restaurants, Avra and Milos however the food quality here doesnâ€™t come close to those two.

Loi is the BEST!!!! My fave!! Alex, one of the owners, always gets me the best table, lucky me!!! He greets everyone as they walk in and makes every guest feel at home. Maria Loi, the Executive Chef/Owner, treats everyone like family and her food is outstandingâ€”bonus points because itâ€™s healthy AND delicious!! Whether weâ€™re celebrating a birthday, or just enjoying a night out with friends, Loi never disappoints. The fish is so fresh and delicious, the lamb shank is so tender, and all of the ingredients are so tasty!!! I never thought I would be excited about a green bell pepper, but the ones she uses in the village salad are so crisp and sweet! Yummmm. I always take out of town guests to Loi and tonight I brought two friends from Greece! They agreed; the food and hospitality are fantastic. If you havenâ€™t been to Loi, what are you waiting for?!??
The food was incredible; the lamb shank was delicious and all of the small plates we ordered were super tasty. Nicole and the entire team were super welcoming and very helpful!

As soon as Nicole greeted as from the hostess stand we were off to the races for an outstanding dining experience.  She is fun to talk with and provides great recommendations. The menu is fantastic and the flavors and quality of the food are top shelf.  Service was great.  We had 7 different items and each was excellent.  A rare menu where you truly canâ€™t go wrong. Every time I am back in New York, Loi will be a must stop whenever possible.
Nicole was so great. And the food was so fresh and delicious!! We will definitely be back!!
Greek food chef hits the mark with her twist

Amazing experience! Nicole and the servers were sooooo friendly and made us feel welcome right away.  We had three apps (octopus, artichoke hearts with peas and the halloumi cheese) and they were divine!   For mains we got the lamb and fish with lemon potatoes and it did not disappoint.  Definitely going back.  The restaurant was so chic and the vibes were great!
Davvero una piacevole sorpresa: ambiente tranquillo ed accogliente.  Ottimo cibo con opzioni gluten free. Davvero promosso a pieni voti

Had a really great experience here! The staff was super friendly and made great suggestions. The lamb was so delicious! Cooked perfectly and melts in your mouth. The food is organic with nothing fried or use of butter. Although the food was delicious, I could not fully give this place 5 stars because it just lacked full flavor. The food tasted very simple and very lightly seasoned, if at all. It was also pretty expensive which I understand because of the location, the services the dining space and so on. However, as someone who comes from ethnic background where things like flavor and spice are such a huge part of my culture, my taste buds left wanting something more so take my review with a much needed grain of salt. On the flip side, if youâ€™re someone looking for food made simply but done extremely well with a more upscale atmosphere and impeccable service, you have to try this place! Iâ€™m not very familiar with Greek food so I can not say how authentic this is but based on Maria, (the owner) story, background and how some of the ingredients are directly flown in from Greece, I do believe it is. If you got the money, want to have a cool experience and love Greek food, I would highly recommend!

A wonderful experience I am grateful to have experienced. Loved the quality of ingredients while maintaining the authentic Greek flavors and recipes. The branzino flown in daily was amazing. I only wish I had more room to try everything ğŸ˜‹ Highly recommended!!

Wish I could give this place six stars. Incredible service, authentic dishes, amazing vibes. The owner Maria is great, she greeted each table and made time to chat and tell stories. You have to go to this place itâ€™s perfect.

Fantastic meal! This was our second time dining at Loi and I enjoyed it just as much, if not more, than the first time. Was just in Greece in May and this meal made me feel like I was back. Chef Maria manages to elevate her dishes without sacrificing their authenticity. The Pastitsio is one of the lightest Iâ€™ve ever had and the flavor was exquisite. The chicken and potatoes with carrot and lemon sauce was fantastic also. We were in pre theatre and had plenty of time to dine. The service was fast without feeling rushed and hospitable. And bonus that we got to see Chef Maria before leaving. She is so sweet! Highly recommend!

Had an amazing evening here. Everything was better than perfection.  Service was excellent and the food was outstanding.  Maria Lou know how to create a fabulous meal and everything is cooked with the health conscience in mind.  If you like Octopusâ€¦ the appetizer was tender and one of the best.

Loi Estiatorio: A Greek Culinary Haven

Loi Estiatorio isnâ€™t just the best Greek restaurant in the United Statesâ€”itâ€™s a place that truly feels like home. Every evening I find myself drawn back to this warm and inviting haven, where the magic of Greece is brought to life by the extraordinary Chef Maria Loi.

Meeting Chef Loi herself is an experience in hospitality and charm. Her warmth and passion for authentic Greek cuisine shine through in every dish she serves, and she is always eager to welcome her guests with open arms, making each visit feel personal and memorable.

The recipes at Loi Estiatorio are unparalleled, featuring traditional Greek dishes that you simply wonâ€™t find anywhere else. Standouts like the Aginares (artichokes) and the hearty, comforting mushroom barley soup showcase the depth and variety of Greek cuisine. These dishes go beyond the usual fare, offering a taste of the real Greece thatâ€™s steeped in tradition and elevated by Chef Loiâ€™s creativity.

The flavors are bold yet refined, with every dish expertly crafted to honor its roots. I am vegan, and I find a plethora of dishes that are rich and delicious, each bite transports you straight to Greece.

The ambiance is equally inviting, blending sophistication with the warmth of a Greek home. Whether youâ€™re there for a romantic dinner, a celebration, or simply to savor good food, the atmosphere is perfect for any occasion.

If youâ€™re looking for a truly authentic and unforgettable Greek dining experience, Loi Estiatorio is the place to be. Itâ€™s no surprise I keep coming backâ€”this is more than a restaurant; itâ€™s a culinary journey led by one of the most hospitable and talented chefs Iâ€™ve ever met. Highly recommended!

Delicious Greek food in a cozy atmosphere.  Friendly, knowledgeable servers. The Dalmas were nice and tender, the hummus and tzaziki were all perfection. Nice wine list.  The salmon was flaky and fresh, as was the branzino.  And the desserts all traditional baklava, Greek tiramisu, yogurt with honey, etc.  We loved everything.
Lisa Steele
The Fresh Eggs Daily Cookbook
Food, service, ambience very good. Waiters are the best. Chef makes creates excellent fresh gourmet foods ever, ty. One of favorite restaurants in NYC, love the intimate atmosphere.

The restaurant's staff was exceptionally attentive, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The ambiance added to the overall experience, and the diverse menu offered delicious, well-presented dishes. A delightful dining experience from start to finish. We had the pleasure of running into chef Maria Loi who treated us very well and gave us a honey yogurt on the house!

Owner and head Chef Maria is an amazing human.
The food was exceptional, great wait staff.
You must try the Greek Yogurt!! Made fresh every day and incredible taste.
Next time I catch a Broadway show, I will stop by this place. It is very easy to catch the subway or walk after dinner to get to Time Square.

A M A Z I N G!!
We got there after seeing good reviews in google.
Maria Loi, the owner and the chef, set us down with welcome hands and Alex, her right hand, was sooo nice .
The food was Amazing! We started with delicious grape leaves and 2 bawls of goddess soups.
The main course was the most delicious, fresh Branzino fish we ever had.
Because we werenâ€™t sure if we want to order the chicken as well, Maria sent us the chicken on the house and it was so soft and tasty.
The last course was the desserts. OMG we tried one of each and each one was better than the other.

In my opinion itâ€™s a must go restaurant.

Thank you Maria Loi and Alex
You are amazing

The best restaurant!!!! I wish could give more stars!!! The place is amazing, the food  drooling my mouth, is so delicious. The service is so fast , and so nice people make you feel so special and very much welcome. Do you know there place many celebrity come with family have dinner? The ex president Barack Obama for example, and many others enjoy there place.  my stomach loves  the food, for me is very important how I feel after dinner; Happy and with desire to return to this incredible place many times. the location is excellent , just want say thank you Loi Estiatorio  for make my night with my family dinner so special. The best place !!! Elegant the high quality restaurant in New York

This used to be our go to, but we havenâ€™t been here in a few years. We had lunch there today â€“ what a great place this continues to be!

All the dishes we had were super fresh, flavorful, and delicious. The spreads were great, dolmadakia were fresh and excellent, and the branzino was perfectly cooked and tasty.

Service continues to be excellent with Chef Loi personally engaged, welcoming guests and overseeing the service.

Weâ€™ll be back soon!

We visited Loi restaurant during Christmas time. Chef Maria is a stunning personality, always there to welcome you and make you feel like home. The food is excellent, and the tastes are all very unique and fresh and all have Maria's signature.

Thank you so much, Maria.

Kostas, Martha, Kiara

Warm, European style hospitality, with a visit to each table from Chef Maria Loi. Delicious food, topped of with real, delectable Greek yogurt. And then, two arias sung by a patron. We didn't want to leave!

By far one of the best Greek restaurants in the city. The price reflects the quality and taste of all the meals that are offered. Management and staff treated myself and my company with kindness and would definitely recommend this place to more friends and family. If youâ€™re ever in the city come check this place out!
Excellent authentic Greek food , many selections. No use of butter  just olive oil , not even for their baklava which was awesome. Very hospitable greek owner also.

Overall, a good spot for Greek food. The olive oil has just the spice you want, and the homemade cornbread (unusual) is a delight. The salad and octopus was also delicious. The branzino and mussels, though, were a bit underwhelming, and the lemon potatoes were crispy but not lemony at all. The chocolate dessert was solid. Good and friendly service!

This place was AMAZING. We ran into it by coincidence. The owner Maria was so friendly. She made sure we had a table even though the restaurant was fully booked. We had the eggplant casserolle and the stuffed eggplant, and it was delicious. The restaurant was cosy/nice atmosphere! I highly recommend this place.

Loi Estiatorio is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in Manhattan. This is the finest Greek cuisine you'll est in New York. The specials are always just that... special. And the regular menu is impressive for the adventurous foodie andâ€¦

Thomas and Nicole welcomed us at the door as family! The entire evening continued in the same vein. Adon walked us through the menu and we chose the Branzino for 2 (of course). Melt in the mouth!
They all surprised us with a special dessert for my husbandâ€™s birthday. The perfect evening!
